long_term: Use for **deep self-exploration, defining core values, setting life purpose, multi-month goal planning, or capability development assessment** (Scope: Life/Vision)
DeBeauvoir: Use for **Guided exercises to identify core values and meaning** as an act of personal freedom (Values & Purpose Exploration).
Nietzsche: Use for **critiquing and dismantling inherited morals** to articulate and define your own new, authentic, life-affirming values (Personal Value Creation Workshop).
Nussbaum: Use for **assessing current capabilities** across various life domains (e.g., health, reason, affiliation) and developing a **long-term plan** for growth (Capabilities Assessment).
Aristotle: Use for **setting overarching life goals** and connecting all efforts to the highest human good (Eudaimonia Planning).
Dewey: Use for **planning long-term community engagement projects** or social experiments, applying the scientific method to real-world problems (Community Experience Laboratory Planning).
Nagarjuna: Use for a **deep mapping of connections and dependencies** to overcome rigid identity, attachment, and suffering (Interdependence Mapping).
